introduction: This video discusses strategies for increasing your chances of getting an internship at IBM Quantum or any other quantum computing company. The focus is on the application process, specifically for hardware, software, and research internships. The speaker emphasizes the importance of making your application as specific as possible and highlights the specific skills needed for each category.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding the Application Process
content: IBM Quantum hosts over a hundred interns every summer, with three specific categories: hardware, software, and research.
Applicants apply to a specific category and their application and resume are put into a pool. Hiring managers select candidates based on specific skills needed for the job.
The application process is crucial as it determines whether you will be considered for an interview.
It's essential to research the company and the specific role you're applying for to create a tailored application.

sections.title: Section 2: Hardware Internships
content: Hardware internships focus on developing hardware components for quantum computing systems.

Specific skills needed for hardware internships include EM/RF and microwave experience, basic or even quantum mechanics experience, and hands-on experience with connectors, power, and mechanical design.
Software development skills for automation purposes are also desired.
Hardware internships require a strong understanding of hardware design and development principles.
topics: Hands-on Experience with Connectors, Power, and Mechanical Design

sections.title: Section 3: Software Internships
content: Software internships focus on developing software components for quantum computing systems.
Specific skills needed for software internships include proficiency in languages like C++, Rust, PiTorch, SQL, Pandas, and Kiske.
Candidates should also demonstrate clean code principles and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Software internships require a strong understanding of software development principles and practices.
topics: C++, Rust, PiTorch, SQL, Pandas, and Kiske

sections.title: Section 4: Research Internships
content: Research internships focus on conducting research in various areas of quantum computing.

Specific skills needed for research internships include a strong foundation in quantum mechanics, programming skills in languages like Python and MATLAB, and experience with quantum simulation software.
Candidates should also demonstrate the ability to work independently and contribute to a research project.
Research internships require a strong understanding of research methodologies and principles.
topics: Programming Skills in Python and MATLAB
Independent Work and Research Project Contribution

sections.title: Section 5: General Tips for Increasing Your Chances
content: It's important to research the company and the specific role you're applying for to create a tailored application.
Be specific about your experience and interests in your application and resume.
Networking and reaching out to people in the industry can also help increase your chances.
Practice your interview skills and be prepared to discuss your relevant experience and skills.
